snippet: The Obama administration on Monday made public a trove of documents, including a court ruling that approved a program to track Americans’ emails during the Bush administration.
abstract: Obama administration releases trove of declassified documents related to National Security Agency surveillance, including ruling in which the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court first approved a program to systematically track Americans’ emails during the Bush administration.

byline.original: By CHARLIE SAVAGE and JAMES RISEN

lead_paragraph: The Obama administration on Monday made public a trove of documents, including a court ruling that approved a program to track Americans’ emails during the Bush administration.

headline.main: Latest Release of Documents on N.S.A. Includes 2004 Ruling on Email Surveillance
headline.print_headline: Latest Release of Documents on N.S.A. Includes 2004 Ruling on Email Surveillance

keywords.value: Office of the Director of National Intelligence
keywords.name: organizations
